Al Qaeda Aussie 'happy' to be jailed on home soil





David Hicks, the first Guantanamo Bay inmate to face a U.S. military tribunal,
was flown back to his hometown of Adelaide on Sunday to serve out the
remainder of his sentence in a maximum security prison cell.

Military officials assuming missing soldiers alive





Commanders are operating under the assumption that at least two of  three U.S.
soldiers missing in Iraq are alive, military officials told CNN.

Shipwreck yields historic riches -- $500M worth 





Deep-sea explorers said Friday they have mined what could be the richest
shipwreck treasure in history, bringing home 17 tons of colonial-era silver
and gold coins from an undisclosed site in the Atlantic Ocean.

Child in day care dies after being bound with tape





A day care worker was being held Saturday in the death of a 2-year-old boy
whose hands were bound and his mouth covered with masking tape, police said.





FULL STORY
















Juveniles' sentences called improper; Texas to free 226





The agency that runs the Texas state juvenile prison system said it will
release 226 inmates after a review found their sentences were improperly
extended.





FULL STORY
















Big Arizona fire nearly tamed





A wildfire that had threatened homes and other structures in two northern
Arizona forests was 80 percent contained Saturday and evacuees were being told
they could return home Sunday morning.

Fatah, Hamas agree to new cease-fire





A cease-fire was brokered Saturday between the rival Palestinian Hamas and
Fatah parties -- the fifth such attempt at peace this week -- as rockets were
fired into Israel following Israeli airstrikes overnight.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Islamic militants, security forces battle in Lebanon





Security forces fought Islamic militants with alleged links to al Qaeda in the
northern city of Tripoli and an adjacent Palestinian refugee camp early
Sunday, and at least five members of the security forces were killed in
fighting that involved tank and grenade fire, security officials said.





FULL STORY
















Homemade bomb kills 6 during celebration in Peru





A backpack containing dynamite and nails exploded during a celebration in a
southern Peruvian market, killing six people and wounding 48, police said
Saturday.





FULL STORY
















Carter blasts Bush, Blair over Iraq war





Britain's support for the war in Iraq was a "major tragedy" for the world,
former U.S. President Jimmy Carter said Saturday, as he criticized Tony
Blair's unwavering support for President Bush.
